intro: Ruehssia guanchezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands ruehssia, is a rare flowering plant endemic to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red and yellow. The plant has adapted to the arid and rocky environments of its native habitat, showcasing succulent leaves that help retain moisture. It is often found growing in coastal areas and is considered a valuable species for botanical research due to its unique ecological niche.
